comment: This is the best DAAP player I've found for my phone. Unfortunately, all that means is that, unlike all the other players, it works once in a while, instead of never.

title: Very little resources
comment: Uses only the resources to stream the song nothing more. I was impressed very much with this app I used this app when I was cutting the grass and I have a big yard, I have wireless repeater about mid way. And it was switching between AP and this app did not shudder one bit. Even if my signal was quite weak. It uses only the amount of data of however big that single song is.

title: Not a bad choice for DAAP music playing
comment: Just a bit clumsy to use and took MUCH longer than some of the other clients to end up with only 50% of the library. Might work for you, but for me there are better options in the play store.

title: Basic
comment: Good auto-discover of server. No NowPlaying, no album art. No genres. Playlists sorted by artist. Queuing of tracks only, can't queue an album.

title: Really good
comment: Just the ticket for playing MP3 media served by firefly from my W7 PC. Worked perfectly on my N5

title: Wounderfull
comment: This app is one of only a few on the market that works with the DAAP proticall. Its allso nice and small. And runs in the background. Even when browsing the web.
Very bad app! Failed to locate and load my daap library. Try SharePlay instead. At least it managed to play my songs....

title: Nothing better
comment: Been using this app for over a year with mt-daap. Haven't found anything better. Nice app.
really great and it's free

title: Qnap/itunes server
comment: Just what was looking for.

title: Love it
comment: Simple interface, fast for large libraries,  just work like a charm

title: Easy to use and works well
comment: This app is simple to use and does the job.
Duplicate song entries

title: Nice looking app.
comment: But that's about all I can say at the moment as this app refuses to play about half of my music with no reason given. It plays some music files just fine, even files that need transcoded, but, it loads that now playing info for a lot of files but then just sits there staring.

title: Doesn't work with Rhythmox
comment: Files are listed, but not playable.

title: Can't get it to do WAN connection
comment: This seems to work fine on home network (LAN)  but doesn't seem to do 2G/3G. I get a message stating that wifi must be activated

title: Jellybean
comment: Upgraded to jellybean and now scrolling down my music is just about impossible and the app keeps freezing

title: Works impressively well
comment: I installed Firefly (forked-daap) on my Ubuntu computer, edited the /etc/forked-daap.cfg, and opened port 3869 on my router and boom!  Free unlimited streaming music on my cell network!  Why bother paying for a streaming & storage service?  Would give higher marks for a more robust music player component (fancier playlist options, cache the database by default and only scan for changes on demand, etc) but 4 is still 80%!

title: Schitterend
comment: Zeer prachtige app, werkt perfect in combinatie met mijn Qnap iTunes server.

title: Doesn't work with large collections
comment: As another user said, it doesn't work with large collections (for me >70,000).

title: Good basic client
comment: Does what it's supposed to do, working great with my Tangerine DAAP server. Scrobbling is nice!   Feature requests: search box, cover art from file, better queue management (add album to queue, for example), better file names when saving files (its daap-number.mp3 now), preferences menu,...   Keep up the great work!
Ok!
Good app

title: OGG format support problem
comment: My DAAP Server is Rhythmbox running on ubuntu. MP3 format works very well, but when playing the song with OGG format, this player cannot play the entire song, only 90% of the song, and then it will suddenly jump to the next song.

title: ReadyNAS + DAAP = music bliss
comment: Installed Firefly on my Netgear ReadyNAS NV+, put it in the DMZ, installed DAAP on my Android, watched the video, and in 60 seconds I am listening to my home music collection over the ATT 3G network in excellent quality.    This is stupid-simple.  Awesome!!!

title: Great App!
comment: Works perfectly with freenas and firefly

title: Nice
comment: Good

title: Does work but is slow
comment: Technically it works but using large media collections (>40.000 items) is painfully slow. It takes forever to load them, it does not cache data so everything has to be reloaded next time, browsing lists is slow.

title: It does what it says
comment: Nice app!  I've been using it with Rhythmbox and I've found a couple of oddities, but since Rhythmbox crashed a couple of times, I don't think is DAAP Media Player fault.

title: Has replaced my roku soundbridge
comment: This app combined with my DI.FM app means my android phone has now officially replaced my roku soundbridge.  I might actually buy a second hand HTC desire from ebay and just use that as my media bridge. I gave my soundbridge so much time and effort but the wireless technology they have used is so poor, I just can't handle the connection issues I have experienced over the past 5 years.  The android wireless on the HTC desire is flawless, and time will tell whether this client can maintain the connection to my router and firefly or not, but seems pretty good so far.  I'm a java developer and I'm always amazed that you guys have time to build stuff like this and offer it for free!  Well done and thanks.

title: Love it!
comment: Works perfectly with my unraid server!

title: Nas
comment: Works perfectly with my goflex home. Beats the rubbish seagate access app.

title: Good start
comment: Nice app for music - needs support for pics - and optomised for tablets.

title: Plays flac for me
comment: UI is a little clunky,  but talks to my forked-daap linux server perfectly. Plays flac too : suspect this depends on my device having flac support at the OS level. Try cyanogenmod if yours doesn't

title: Needs to look more appealing
comment: Works well and fast. Just looks boring.

title: Connects with Linux
comment: Works well with mp3. Too bad about ogg format.
Works well

title: Permissions
comment: Colin, phone state and identity is needed to pause playback when a call comes through. Do research on your own before posting a misinformed comment.

title: Good app, please fix permissions
comment: I second the other reviews, WTF does this app need to "read phone state and identity" ????  Uninstalled until there's suggestion it has been fixed.   Otherwise good app, worked without error with Rhythmbox, would consider paying a dollars for it if permissions are sorted out.
Super responsive dev . Excellent customer service!

title: Always running
comment: Works great but why does it always need to be running in the background and startup?

title: Brilliant
comment: Worked perfectly over wifi & 3G (3rd party setup required for 3G). Found my Firefly server almost immediately via wifi, very easy to add servers if needed.

title: Brilliant
comment: Brilliant

title: Almost perfect
comment: Great App: found my NAS/firefly at once.  But I really miss "Album artist" as a filter/tab. Can I report this as a wish? Otherwise it would be a 4/5 star

title: Excellent!
comment: I can connect to my library easily.

title: Great!
comment: Works well with my forked-daapd server on Linux Mint 12!

title: Excellent
comment: So easy to set up! Good work!

title: Great
comment: Finally,  all my music fits on my phone.

title: Great!
comment: No flac support. Connects to my nas box with out issue. Player is very simple with No frills. I would give it four stars but the one extra star is for

title: Great app!
comment: Plays nicely with tangerine, though lacks FLAC support. Would be nice to see some loseless love in future releases, thanks!

title: FLAC support?
comment: The app works fantastic for connecting to my firefly server, but 97% of the songs on there are in flac and won't play, any chance you guys could include FLAC support with future releases?

title: Amazing!
comment: Streaming my library from my home FreeNAS box. Works like a charm.

title: Doesn't play
comment: Connects to Firefly server on ReadyNAS Ultra, lists songs/albums/artists, but doesn't play tracks.  Server indicates "Streaming '<track name>'".  Phone is LG Thrive.

title: Best DAAP client
comment: This app works very good, ad only few issues with it on my HTC. But still lots of improvements can be made. Keep on, developer!

title: Fantastic app
comment: Wish it could pull cover art out of the files.

title: Great but not perfect
comment: Love using it with my firefly server, best app available for remote share. Would like to see integration with music controls (cm7, for example).r
What's with the phone call permissions?
Does not work with qnap 210

title: best
comment: best rythmbox brother I love it on my galxy tab

title: Works
comment: Works as advertised

title: Does not work with forked-daapd version 16
comment: Says it all. Can't wait for a fix.

title: Great!
comment: Works as advertised.
Interface is a basic. Support for a single playlist, but no way to add a whole album to it or to see where you are in it.

title: Perfect
comment: This app works as advertised. No issue with it all

title: No frills, but works well
comment: I like the simple interface. A couple issues. Sometimes it will lose sync with the server and doesn't auto-reconnect. Max queue needs to be longer. Wish I could create local playlists. But... it works, and I use it all the time. Atrix used with svn Firefly on ubuntu.
Good application!!!!
Basic but fonctional
Crashes if your library is too big. Doesn't scrobble.
Functional but basic
Love this app! Wish the UI would get a face-lift though!
I love this app. Doesn't crash as often when using headphones. HTC Incredible
Crashes constantly. If you can get music playing you can leave the force close up and it will keep going.
couldnt connect even though my firefly server was visible and accessible to other clients

title: Great app!
comment: however I can't stream many files using mt-daapd/milestone 2.1.EDIT: works great on gingerbread

title: Worked like a charm
comment: A brilliant idea and worked really well on my Galaxy S. Now I can have my music collection anywhere in the house. Simply to setup and use.
Did not work for me
Great app, works well, very simple interface. HTC Desire + Qnap 109
Amazing. Only changes would be not display artist when displaying track names, caching and ignore "the" in sorting. Makes me want 4G so bad.
Thank you for this great app. Simple to use. Love having access to all my music on the go!
Using it with my dlink dns-323, awesome except my firefly wont stop streaming after I stop a song

title: Great when working...
comment: Currently able to connect to server and browse collection, but cannot play songs. T-Mobile Pulse (2.1-update1)
Loads library but songs don't play. Droid X.
Easy to install and easy to operate! Love it!
Good client for the android platform. Been looking for a good daap client since 1.5 days and this is what I have been looking for. Thank You!
Main screen takes forever to refresh. Can't edit a share, have to delete it and add it again.
Would be better if it cached the library locally and only added the changes every time it started (like the java firefly client).
Does exactly what it claims. Perfect!
Works very well; thanks! (DInc, senseless froyo, custom kernel, latest radio, ubuntu firefly w/20k songs, 3G and WiFi)
Good app, could do with an odd interface tweak
What's better than having all your mp3s on your phone? Not having them on your phone. Set up passworded access. Awesome. Streaming glitches fixed!
Works great with Firefly from my Desire. UI could do with a polish but it's excellent for the price.
Works really well with my firefly media server sharing my itunes library. Nicely done. Cloud? Who needs it. :-)
Works as advertised, nothing spectacular.
Works great on Evo with CM6 and firefly on my Mac... connected over dyndns. Perfect for a library bigger than my SD card.
Works well - G1 Cyanogen 6.1
UI needs to be improved, is it possible to show the album art?
Works great with Droid 1, DNS-323 over ssh tunnel port forwarding using connectbot. Now i have a huge storage of music anywhere i go!
COULDN'T GET IT TO WORK ! GOING TO UNINSTALL IT!
Don't understand how to uses it. Does show how to uses.
Does what it says. No complaints.
Doesn't want to play streamed flac - but mp3 ok. Nexus One + rhythmbox/lucid.
Works great.. but latest version has problems on milestone. Downgrade and it is fine.
Very responsive dev. A great start.
Much better out there
Very good, gummi snodd =0)

Good but needs improvement - don't like how it displays artist title
Love that this plays nicely with my freenas server, one feature I would like to see the ability to create playlists. great app samsung fascinate
Would love it if this worked. Seems to grind to a halt and fall over with large libraries. Never managed to play a track.
works but with glitches droid x
Works on my wireless lan streaming from my laptop running Ubuntu 10.10 64bit on rhythmbox music player with my rooted HTC Hero CDMA rooted running CM6
Works great on motorola i1 1.5
installed a minute ago, streaming music no problem. haven't explored this much but it seems to get the job done just fine.
Thanks!
Great though doesnt keep original ordering within a playlist
Nice app, still needs some work. Forexample preloading the next track in the queue, list the specific folders you've put the music into.
Works with mt-daap.
Only app that I have found that does DAAP, aka itunes streaming UI is not ready for prime time but gets the job done.
Great app.
Just what I need! Perfect!
Excellent app. Does exactly what it says. Steaming from my NAS which is running a DAAP/Itunes music server. Five stars.
Great! Just what I needed! Works great thanks! Desire 2.2
Awesome, thanks :) Any chance of supporting the headphone pause button?
Super program

Fantastic

Just amazing! FreeNAS firefly. Streaming to my phone then to my car radio! No more ads ever and only plays music I like!

Use it with my rhythmbox on ubuntu. Works perfect
No one uses pre-7 iTunes, so the app's essentially worthless. Shouldn't have released without cracking post-7.
Listening to my music right now, over openvpn over 3G.. not perfect yet but awesome nonetheless. Keep up the great work !
Works great with my firefly media server. Only thing I'd like to see added is the ability to download entire albums instead of individual songs.
Well done. Connected immediately to my freenas box. Now im looking for the exact same but video besides orb. Great app
Great app but does have playback issues for me where the sound disappears on streaming. Look forward to new versions!
Off to a great start! I'm looking forward to updates!
Amazing app. Background playback would be a plus, but for now I can deal. Thanks!
